alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 3:37PM PDT until August 19 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The McKinney burn scar in... North Central Siskiyou County in northern California... * Until 530 PM PDT. * At 337 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the McKinney Burn Scar. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Some drainage basins. Impacted basins include... McKinney Creek, Barkhouse Creek, Humbug Creek, Little Humbug Creek, and Vesa Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the McKinney Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...High water and debris could impact Highway 96 and Klamath River Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the McKinney Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
